title: Citi Costa Rica Donates 100,000 Surgical Masks To The Country's Red Cross
summary: San José, Costa Rica - Gijs Veltman, General Manager of Citi Costa Rica, delivered more than 100,000 surgical masks to the Costa Rican Red Cross to be used in emergency situations and to support public health initiatives.
tag-1: Citi Costa Rica Donates 100,000 Surgical Masks To The Country's Red Cross
tag-3: San José, Costa Rica – Gijs Veltman, General Manager of Citi Costa Rica, delivered more than 100,000 surgical masks to the Costa Rican Red Cross to be used in emergency situations and to support public health initiatives.
tag-4: The Red Cross is an organization that protects the vulnerable and provides humanitarian aid in case of disasters, accidents or emergencies. The time-honored institution has 117 auxiliary committees throughout Costa Rica, where it has operated since 1885.
tag-5: "In the past, we've had situations, such as the 2009 flu outbreak, that require distributing masks to the population. For us, the concept of social responsibility goes far beyond working toward financial inclusion," Veltman commented. "We also care about the health and well being of the population."
tag-6: "The Costa Rican Red Cross is profoundly grateful for Citi's generous contribution," Miguel Carmona, head of the institution, noted. "When private companies such as Citi Costa Rica voluntarily join efforts to improve the quality of life of Costa Ricans, it has strong repercussions for the numbers of volunteers who work alongside humanitarian organizations in campaigns to save lives."
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
